content: 1 Paul, apostle of Christ Jesus, by God’s will, and Timotheus the brother,
content_old: 1 Paul, apostle of Christ Jesus, by God’s will, and Timotheus the brother,

content: 2 to the holy and faithful brethren in Christ which are in Colosse. Grace to you and peace from God our Father and Lord Jesus Christ.
content_old: 2 to the holy and faithful brethren in Christ which are in Colosse. Grace to you and peace from God our Father and Lord Jesus Christ.

content: 3 We give thanks to the God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ continually when praying for you,
content_old: 3 We give thanks to the God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ continually when praying for you,

content: 4 having heard of your faith in Christ Jesus, and the love which ye have towards all the saints,
content_old: 4 having heard of your faith in Christ Jesus, and the love which ye have towards all the saints,

content: 5 on account of the hope which is laid up for you in the heavens; of which ye heard before in the word of the truth of the glad tidings,
content_old: 5 on account of the hope which is laid up for you in the heavens; of which ye heard before in the word of the truth of the glad tidings,

content: 6 which are come to you, as they are in all the world, and are bearing fruit and growing, even as also among you, from the day ye heard them and knew indeed the grace of God, in truth:
content_old: 6 which are come to you, as they are in all the world, and are bearing fruit and growing, even as also among you, from the day ye heard them and knew indeed the grace of God, in truth:

content: 7 even as ye learned from Epaphras our beloved fellow-bondman, who is a faithful minister of Christ for you,
content_old: 7 even as ye learned from Epaphras our beloved fellow-bondman, who is a faithful minister of Christ for you,

content: 8 who has also manifested to us your love in the Spirit.
content_old: 8 who has also manifested to us your love in the Spirit.

content: 9 For this reason we also, from the day we heard of your faith and love, do not cease praying and asking for you, to the end that ye may be filled with the full knowledge of his will, in all wisdom and spiritual understanding,
content_old: 9 For this reason we also, from the day we heard of your faith and love, do not cease praying and asking for you, to the end that ye may be filled with the full knowledge of his will, in all wisdom and spiritual understanding,

content: 10 so as to walk worthily of the Lord unto all well-pleasing, bearing fruit in every good work, and growing by the true knowledge of God;
content_old: 10 so as to walk worthily of the Lord unto all well-pleasing, bearing fruit in every good work, and growing by the true knowledge of God;

content: 11 strengthened with all power according to the might of his glory unto all endurance and longsuffering with joy;
content_old: 11 strengthened with all power according to the might of his glory unto all endurance and longsuffering with joy;

content: 12 giving thanks to the Father, who has made us fit for sharing the portion of the saints in light,
content_old: 12 giving thanks to the Father, who has made us fit for sharing the portion of the saints in light,

content: 13 who has delivered us from the authority of darkness, and translated us into the kingdom of the Son of his love:
content_old: 13 who has delivered us from the authority of darkness, and translated us into the kingdom of the Son of his love:

content: 14 in whom we have redemption, the forgiveness of sins;
content_old: 14 in whom we have redemption, the forgiveness of sins;

content: 15 who is image of the invisible God, firstborn of all creation;
content_old: 15 who is image of the invisible God, firstborn of all creation;

content: 16 because by him were created all things, the things in the heavens and the things upon the earth, the visible and the invisible, whether thrones, or lordships, or principalities, or authorities: all things have been created by him and for him.
content_old: 16 because by him were created all things, the things in the heavens and the things upon the earth, the visible and the invisible, whether thrones, or lordships, or principalities, or authorities: all things have been created by him and for him.

content: 17 And he is before all, and all things subsist together by him.
content_old: 17 And he is before all, and all things subsist together by him.

content: 18 And he is the head of the body, the assembly; who is the beginning, firstborn from among the dead, that he might have the first place in all things:
content_old: 18 And he is the head of the body, the assembly; who is the beginning, firstborn from among the dead, that he might have the first place in all things:

content: 19 for in him all the fulness of the Godhead was pleased to dwell,
content_old: 19 for in him all the fulness of the Godhead was pleased to dwell,

content: 20 and by him to reconcile all things to itself, having made peace by the blood of his cross—by him, whether the things on the earth or the things in the heavens.
content_old: 20 and by him to reconcile all things to itself, having made peace by the blood of his cross—by him, whether the things on the earth or the things in the heavens.

content: 21 And you, who once were alienated and enemies in mind by wicked works, yet now has it reconciled
content_old: 21 And you, who once were alienated and enemies in mind by wicked works, yet now has it reconciled

content: 22 in the body of his flesh through death; to present you holy and unblamable and irreproachable before it,
content_old: 22 in the body of his flesh through death; to present you holy and unblamable and irreproachable before it,

content: 23 if indeed ye abide in the faith founded and firm, and not moved away from the hope of the glad tidings, which ye have heard, which have been proclaimed in the whole creation which is under heaven, of which I Paul became minister.
content_old: 23 if indeed ye abide in the faith founded and firm, and not moved away from the hope of the glad tidings, which ye have heard, which have been proclaimed in the whole creation which is under heaven, of which I Paul became minister.

content: 24 Now, I rejoice in sufferings for you, and I fill up that which is behind of the tribulations of Christ in my flesh, for his body, which is the assembly;
content_old: 24 Now, I rejoice in sufferings for you, and I fill up that which is behind of the tribulations of Christ in my flesh, for his body, which is the assembly;

content: 25 of which I became minister, according to the dispensation of God which is given me towards you to complete the word of God,
content_old: 25 of which I became minister, according to the dispensation of God which is given me towards you to complete the word of God,

content: 26 the mystery which has been hidden from ages and from generations, but has now been made manifest to his saints;
content_old: 26 the mystery which has been hidden from ages and from generations, but has now been made manifest to his saints;

content: 27 to whom God would make known what are the riches of the glory of this mystery among the nations, which is Christ in you the hope of glory:
content_old: 27 to whom God would make known what are the riches of the glory of this mystery among the nations, which is Christ in you the hope of glory:

content: 28 whom we announce, admonishing every man, and teaching every man, in all wisdom, to the end that we may present every man perfect in Christ.
content_old: 28 whom we announce, admonishing every man, and teaching every man, in all wisdom, to the end that we may present every man perfect in Christ.

content: 1 For I would have you know what combat I have for you, and those in Laodicea, and as many as have not seen my face in flesh;
content_old: 1 For I would have you know what combat I have for you, and those in Laodicea, and as many as have not seen my face in flesh;

content: 2 to the end that their hearts may be encouraged, being united together in love, and unto all riches of the full assurance of understanding, to the full knowledge of the mystery of God;
content_old: 2 to the end that their hearts may be encouraged, being united together in love, and unto all riches of the full assurance of understanding, to the full knowledge of the mystery of God;

content: 3 in which are hid all the treasures of wisdom and of knowledge.
content_old: 3 in which are hid all the treasures of wisdom and of knowledge.

content: 4 And I say this to the end that no one may delude you by persuasive speech.
content_old: 4 And I say this to the end that no one may delude you by persuasive speech.

content: 5 For if indeed in the flesh I am absent, yet I am with you in spirit, rejoicing and seeing your order, and the firmness of your faith in Christ.
content_old: 5 For if indeed in the flesh I am absent, yet I am with you in spirit, rejoicing and seeing your order, and the firmness of your faith in Christ.

content: 6 As therefore ye have received the Christ, Jesus the Lord, walk in him,
content_old: 6 As therefore ye have received the Christ, Jesus the Lord, walk in him,

content: 7 rooted and built up in him, and assured in the faith, even as ye have been taught, abounding in it with thanksgiving.
content_old: 7 rooted and built up in him, and assured in the faith, even as ye have been taught, abounding in it with thanksgiving.

content: 8 See that there be no one who shall lead you away as a prey through philosophy and vain deceit, according to the teaching of men, according to the elements of the world, and not according to Christ.
content_old: 8 See that there be no one who shall lead you away as a prey through philosophy and vain deceit, according to the teaching of men, according to the elements of the world, and not according to Christ.

content: 9 For in him dwells all the fulness of the Godhead bodily;
content_old: 9 For in him dwells all the fulness of the Godhead bodily;

content: 10 and ye are complete in him, who is the head of all principality and authority,
content_old: 10 and ye are complete in him, who is the head of all principality and authority,

content: 11 in whom also ye have been circumcised with circumcision not done by hand, in the putting off of the body of the flesh, in the circumcision of the Christ;
content_old: 11 in whom also ye have been circumcised with circumcision not done by hand, in the putting off of the body of the flesh, in the circumcision of the Christ;

content: 12 buried with him in baptism, in which ye have been also raised with him through faith of the working of God who raised him from among the dead.
content_old: 12 buried with him in baptism, in which ye have been also raised with him through faith of the working of God who raised him from among the dead.

content: 13 And you, being dead in offences and in the uncircumcision of your flesh, he has quickened together with him, having forgiven us all the offences;
content_old: 13 And you, being dead in offences and in the uncircumcision of your flesh, he has quickened together with him, having forgiven us all the offences;

content: 14 having effaced the handwriting in ordinances which stood out against us, which was contrary to us, he has taken it also out of the way, having nailed it to the cross;
content_old: 14 having effaced the handwriting in ordinances which stood out against us, which was contrary to us, he has taken it also out of the way, having nailed it to the cross;

content: 15 having spoiled principalities and authorities, he made a show of them publicly, leading them in triumph by it.
content_old: 15 having spoiled principalities and authorities, he made a show of them publicly, leading them in triumph by it.

content: 16 Let none therefore judge you in meat or in drink, or in matter of feast, or new moon, or sabbaths,
content_old: 16 Let none therefore judge you in meat or in drink, or in matter of feast, or new moon, or sabbaths,

content: 17 which are a shadow of things to come; but the body is of Christ.
content_old: 17 which are a shadow of things to come; but the body is of Christ.

content: 18 Let no one fraudulently deprive you of your prize, doing his own will in humility and worship of angels, entering into things which he has not seen, vainly puffed up by the mind of his flesh,
content_old: 18 Let no one fraudulently deprive you of your prize, doing his own will in humility and worship of angels, entering into things which he has not seen, vainly puffed up by the mind of his flesh,

content: 19 and not holding fast the head, from whom all the body, ministered to and united together by the joints and bands, increases with the increase of God.
content_old: 19 and not holding fast the head, from whom all the body, ministered to and united together by the joints and bands, increases with the increase of God.

content: 20 If ye have died with Christ from the elements of the world, why as if alive in the world do ye subject yourselves to ordinances?
content_old: 20 If ye have died with Christ from the elements of the world, why as if alive in the world do ye subject yourselves to ordinances?

content: 21 Do not handle, do not taste, do not touch,
content_old: 21 Do not handle, do not taste, do not touch,

content: 22 (things which are all for destruction in the using of them:) according to the injunctions and teachings of men,
content_old: 22 (things which are all for destruction in the using of them:) according to the injunctions and teachings of men,

content: 1 If therefore ye have been raised with the Christ, seek the things which are above, where the Christ is, sitting at the right hand of God:
content_old: 1 If therefore ye have been raised with the Christ, seek the things which are above, where the Christ is, sitting at the right hand of God:

content: 2 have your mind on the things that are above, not on the things that are on the earth;
content_old: 2 have your mind on the things that are above, not on the things that are on the earth;

content: 3 for ye have died, and your life is hid with the Christ in God.
content_old: 3 for ye have died, and your life is hid with the Christ in God.

content: 4 When the Christ is manifested who is our life, then shall ye also be manifested with him in glory.
content_old: 4 When the Christ is manifested who is our life, then shall ye also be manifested with him in glory.

content: 5 Put to death therefore your members which are upon the earth, fornication, uncleanness, vile passions, evil lust, and unbridled desire, which is idolatry.
content_old: 5 Put to death therefore your members which are upon the earth, fornication, uncleanness, vile passions, evil lust, and unbridled desire, which is idolatry.

content: 6 On account of which things the wrath of God comes upon the sons of disobedience.
content_old: 6 On account of which things the wrath of God comes upon the sons of disobedience.

content: 7 In which ye also once walked when ye lived in these things.
content_old: 7 In which ye also once walked when ye lived in these things.

content: 8 But now, put off, ye also, all these things, wrath, anger, malice, blasphemy, vile language out of your mouth.
content_old: 8 But now, put off, ye also, all these things, wrath, anger, malice, blasphemy, vile language out of your mouth.

content: 9 Do not lie to one another, having put off the old man with his deeds,
content_old: 9 Do not lie to one another, having put off the old man with his deeds,

content: 10 and having put on the new, renewed into full knowledge according to the image of him that has created him;
content_old: 10 and having put on the new, renewed into full knowledge according to the image of him that has created him;

content: 11 wherein there is not Greek and Jew, circumcision and uncircumcision, barbarian, Scythian, bondman, freeman; but Christ is everything, and in all.
content_old: 11 wherein there is not Greek and Jew, circumcision and uncircumcision, barbarian, Scythian, bondman, freeman; but Christ is everything, and in all.

content: 12 Put on therefore, as the elect of God, holy and beloved, bowels of compassion, kindness, lowliness, meekness, longsuffering;
content_old: 12 Put on therefore, as the elect of God, holy and beloved, bowels of compassion, kindness, lowliness, meekness, longsuffering;

content: 13 forbearing one another, and forgiving one another, if any should have a complaint against any; even as the Christ has forgiven you, so also do ye.
content_old: 13 forbearing one another, and forgiving one another, if any should have a complaint against any; even as the Christ has forgiven you, so also do ye.

content: 14 And to all these add love, which is the bond of perfectness.
content_old: 14 And to all these add love, which is the bond of perfectness.

content: 15 And let the peace of Christ preside in your hearts, to which also ye have been called in one body, and be thankful.
content_old: 15 And let the peace of Christ preside in your hearts, to which also ye have been called in one body, and be thankful.

content: 16 Let the word of the Christ dwell in you richly, in all wisdom teaching and admonishing one another, in psalms, hymns, spiritual songs, singing with grace in your hearts to God.
content_old: 16 Let the word of the Christ dwell in you richly, in all wisdom teaching and admonishing one another, in psalms, hymns, spiritual songs, singing with grace in your hearts to God.

content: 17 And everything, whatever ye may do in word or in deed, do all things in the name of the Lord Jesus, giving thanks to God the Father by him.
content_old: 17 And everything, whatever ye may do in word or in deed, do all things in the name of the Lord Jesus, giving thanks to God the Father by him.

content: 18 Wives, be subject to your husbands, as is fitting in the Lord.
content_old: 18 Wives, be subject to your husbands, as is fitting in the Lord.

content: 19 Husbands, love your wives, and be not bitter against them.
content_old: 19 Husbands, love your wives, and be not bitter against them.

content: 20 Children, obey your parents in all things, for this is well-pleasing in the Lord.
content_old: 20 Children, obey your parents in all things, for this is well-pleasing in the Lord.

content: 21 Fathers, do not vex your children, to the end that they be not disheartened.
content_old: 21 Fathers, do not vex your children, to the end that they be not disheartened.

content: 22 Bondmen, obey in all things your masters according to flesh; not with eye-services, as men-pleasers, but in simplicity of heart, fearing the Lord.
content_old: 22 Bondmen, obey in all things your masters according to flesh; not with eye-services, as men-pleasers, but in simplicity of heart, fearing the Lord.

content: 23 Whatsoever ye do, labour at it heartily, as doing it to the Lord, and not to men;
content_old: 23 Whatsoever ye do, labour at it heartily, as doing it to the Lord, and not to men;

content: 24 knowing that of the Lord ye shall receive the recompense of the inheritance; ye serve the Lord Christ.
content_old: 24 knowing that of the Lord ye shall receive the recompense of the inheritance; ye serve the Lord Christ.

content: 1 Masters, give to bondmen what is just and fair, knowing that ye also have a Master in the heavens.
content_old: 1 Masters, give to bondmen what is just and fair, knowing that ye also have a Master in the heavens.

content: 2 Persevere in prayer, watching in it with thanksgiving;
content_old: 2 Persevere in prayer, watching in it with thanksgiving;

content: 3 praying at the same time for us also, that God may open to us a door of the word to speak the mystery of Christ, on account of which also I am bound,
content_old: 3 praying at the same time for us also, that God may open to us a door of the word to speak the mystery of Christ, on account of which also I am bound,

content: 4 to the end that I may make it manifest as I ought to speak.
content_old: 4 to the end that I may make it manifest as I ought to speak.

content: 5 Walk in wisdom towards those without, redeeming opportunities.
content_old: 5 Walk in wisdom towards those without, redeeming opportunities.

content: 6 Let your word be always with grace, seasoned with salt, so as to know how ye ought to answer each one.
content_old: 6 Let your word be always with grace, seasoned with salt, so as to know how ye ought to answer each one.

content: 7 Tychicus, the beloved brother and faithful minister and fellow-bondman in the Lord, will make known to you all that concerns me;
content_old: 7 Tychicus, the beloved brother and faithful minister and fellow-bondman in the Lord, will make known to you all that concerns me;

content: 8 whom I have sent to you for this very purpose, that he might know your state, and that he might encourage your hearts:
content_old: 8 whom I have sent to you for this very purpose, that he might know your state, and that he might encourage your hearts:

content: 9 with Onesimus, the faithful and beloved brother, who is one of you. They shall make known to you everything here.
content_old: 9 with Onesimus, the faithful and beloved brother, who is one of you. They shall make known to you everything here.

content: 10 Aristarchus my fellow-captive salutes you, and Mark, Barnabas’s cousin, concerning whom ye have received orders, (if he come to you, receive him,)
content_old: 10 Aristarchus my fellow-captive salutes you, and Mark, Barnabas’s cousin, concerning whom ye have received orders, (if he come to you, receive him,)

content: 11 and Jesus called Justus, who are of the circumcision. These are the only fellow-workers for the kingdom of God who have been a consolation to me.
content_old: 11 and Jesus called Justus, who are of the circumcision. These are the only fellow-workers for the kingdom of God who have been a consolation to me.

content: 12 Epaphras, who is one of you, the bondman of Christ Jesus, salutes you, always combating earnestly for you in prayers, to the end that ye may stand perfect and complete in all the will of God.
content_old: 12 Epaphras, who is one of you, the bondman of Christ Jesus, salutes you, always combating earnestly for you in prayers, to the end that ye may stand perfect and complete in all the will of God.

content: 13 For I bear him witness that he labours much for you, and them in Laodicea, and them in Hierapolis.
content_old: 13 For I bear him witness that he labours much for you, and them in Laodicea, and them in Hierapolis.

content: 14 Luke, the beloved physician, salutes you, and Demas.
content_old: 14 Luke, the beloved physician, salutes you, and Demas.

content: 15 Salute the brethren in Laodicea, and Nymphas, and the assembly which is in his house.
content_old: 15 Salute the brethren in Laodicea, and Nymphas, and the assembly which is in his house.

content: 16 And when the letter has been read among you, cause that it be read also in the assembly of Laodiceans, and that ye also read that from Laodicea.
content_old: 16 And when the letter has been read among you, cause that it be read also in the assembly of Laodiceans, and that ye also read that from Laodicea.

content: 17 And say to Archippus, Take heed to the ministry which thou hast received in the Lord, to the end that thou fulfil it.
content_old: 17 And say to Archippus, Take heed to the ministry which thou hast received in the Lord, to the end that thou fulfil it.
